availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Tinsley (Knox County, Kentucky, sgt, liut & adj in 3rd Ky Inf, 7th Ky Inf, 49th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Alfred Tinsley and Mary Craig Tinsley. Married to Elizabeth Hanna Tinsley. Student in Knox County in 1850. Resident of Knox County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant from September 22, 1861, to January 25, 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from January 25, 1863, to August 4, 1863. Served in the 49th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant and adjutant from December 23, 1863, to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 335B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barbourville, p. 26.
